lead_paragraph: The president, reacting to a grisly video that showed Mr. Castile being shot by the police in Minnesota, asked the nation to confront racial disparities in law enforcement.

byline.contributor: Matt Furber reported from St. Paul, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Reporting was contributed by Christina Capecchi from St. Paul, Jonah Engel Bromwich and Michael McPhate from New York, Gardiner Harris from Washington and Mitch Smith from Minnesota.
byline.original: By MATT FURBER and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

headline.print_headline: 11 Officers Shot, 4 Fatally, at Rally Against Violence
headline.main: After Philando Castile’s Killing, Obama Calls Police Shootings ‘an American Issue’

snippet: The president, reacting to a grisly video that showed Mr. Castile being shot by the police in Minnesota, asked the nation to confront racial disparities in law enforcement....
abstract: Eleven police officers are shot, and five killed, during targeted attack at rally in Dallas held to protest police violence; shooting occurs after Pres Obama begs nation to confront racial disparities in law enforcement in wake of police shooting in Minnesota that left black man Philando Castile dead.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dallas, Tex, Shooting of Police Officers (2016)
